page.title: 03TYPES OF HOUSING
page.content: In general, houses in the Failsworth district tend to be of mixed type, built since World War 2 of brick construction and owner occupied. The mixed nature of the housing stock is amplified by the wide distribution of churches, pubs, shops, schools etc. There is no town centre as such. Many shops are concentrated along Oldham Rd (A62) while other facilities have grown up to serve housing estates. { Back to back terrace housing}built around the turn of the century is still evident in many places, particularly near Oldham Road and towards Hollinwood. Some terraces have and still are being demolished - to be replaced by flats or commercial land use. Recent housing has taken the form of small, private "gap-filling" developments - usually bungalows.
